value.title: Microsoft cuts dozens of staff as it shifts to AI for MSN news stories
value.excerpt: Workforce automation is about to cost dozens of news contractors their jobs. The Seattle Times and The Guardian report that Microsoft is letting go of dozens of news contractors (about 50 in the US, 27 in the UK) after June 30th due to a shift to AI news production on MSN.

value.title: Waymo's self-driving minivans will return to California streets in June
value.excerpt: The Alphabet-owned company shut down a public testing program for its self-driving minivans in early March, as the global pandemic started to reshape society in the United States. Now that fleet will reportedly return to the streets of San Francisco on June 8.

value.title: Microsoft lays off journalists to replace them with AI

value.title: ACLU sues Clearview AI over 'unlawful' facial recognition technology
value.excerpt: Facial recognition software provider Clearview AI has been hit with a lawsuit by the American Civil Liberties Union and several other organizations.
